Entities¶

class orinoco.entities.ActionConfig(*, INPUT: Dict[str, orinoco.types.SignatureT[Any]] = None, OUTPUT: orinoco.types.SignatureT[T] = None)[source]¶
class orinoco.entities.ActionData(*, data: Tuple[Tuple[orinoco.types.SignatureT[Any], Any], …] = None, futures: List[Awaitable[Any]] = None, observers: List[orinoco.types.ObserverT] = None, skip_processing: bool = False)[source]¶

Fundamental data structure which is both input and output of actions.

Virtual keys: To save a memory some data are not stored directly, but just a method how to get them from other data stored in ActionData.

ActionData.data, ActionData.virtual_keys and ActionData are immutable data structures, so usually a copy is made after every action it pass thru with the new data.

History of all actions done on the dataset are recorded in ActionData.actions_done.

as_keyed_dict() → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Export self into a dictionary for keys-values for signatures which have keys set

Returns

evolve(**data: Any) → orinoco.entities.ActionData[source]¶

Add values to the data with signatures created from keys (parameter names)

Already registered data with signatures with keys matching the new will be removed and replaced by the new ones

Find values which match the signature

find_one(searched_signature: orinoco.types.SignatureT[T]) → T[source]¶

Find single value which match the signature

:raises

  • NothingFound: When no data match the signature

  • FoundMoreThanOne: When multiple data match the signature

Add new value with the given signature :param signature: Signature of the entity :param entity: Entity which will be added :param check_if_exists: Controls whether the method raises an exception if a value with the signature exists :return: Copy of itself
